in Norse mythology (= ancient stories from Scandinavia), the god of war and death: Norse mythology has it that Odin's horse was a giant, flying, eight-legged beast called Sleipnir.
More examplesFewer examplesFreya became one of the wives of Odin.Odin's servant Muninn informed Thor that Odin was dead.The Germanic tribes regarded the eagle as the bird of the god Odin. The peasants never harvested a field without putting out a sheaf for Odin's horse.
